channel.title: Ubuntu internet doesnt work
channel.description: I filled out all info correctly. I plugged it in directly, and the internet rarely works. Most of the time it doesn't work, and sometimes it loads VERY slow but then right after stops working. Whats wrong?

item.title: Ubuntu internet doesnt work
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Strange, the people in irc.freenode.net #ubuntu might be able to help you.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu internet doesnt work
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

I did everything you said, it is still very slow, then I tried not using the router, still VERY slow or not working at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu internet doesnt work
item.dc:creator: @r4ndom1 r4ndom1
item.description:
@r4ndom1 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:152699”]Run a command in a terminal application:

sudo nano /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist

Now scroll down to the bottom, enter what I told you, hit ctrl+o to save, then ctrl+x to quit.

You can open it with a graphical editor, but I don’t know what the graphical sudo command or the default text editor in ubuntu is, can anyone help him out there? (ie, in kubuntu it would be ‘kdesu kate /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist’)[/quote]

in ubuntu it is

sudo gedit /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist

simply paste that into terminal with right click (not ctrl v) and enter your password (it will not come up with stars or any real indication that you are typing something in) and press enter.

then paste

blacklist ipv6

as mopar suggested into the bottem line of the file and press ctrl s to save it. Then close the window. You will probably need to reboot for the changes to take effect or use this command to restart networking.

sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart

once again type that in your terminal as before you might not need to type your password this time.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu internet doesnt work
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Run a command in a terminal application:

sudo nano /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist

Now scroll down to the bottom, enter what I told you, hit ctrl+o to save, then ctrl+x to quit.

You can open it with a graphical editor, but I don’t know what the graphical sudo command or the default text editor in ubuntu is, can anyone help him out there? (ie, in kubuntu it would be ‘kdesu kate /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist’)

Read full topic

You use your login password when sudo asks you for a password.

item.title: Ubuntu internet doesnt work
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Try putting:

‘blacklist ipv6’

into /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist

Some routers really hate it when you try to use IPv6, making the internet painfully slow or not even work.

Read full topic
